name: Amie's African Kitchen & Grill
vicinity: 4515 Village Fair Dr Suite E4, Dallas

reviews.text: First time here. The egusi was spicy and good. But it tasted different than any other places I've been to. It was a lot darker as well, and no, i don't think it was because of the palm oil. Maybe it was overcooked, I don't know. It was still good to me. I'll definitely be back. I do wish they had prices on the pictures or a menu out with prices. I was charged more than the menu I say online. So that's my complaint. If you're in the area, check them out.
I had the oxtail as well as the egusi soup with fufu. They were flavorful and the serving sizes were good.
Came from San Antonio stopped by this place and the food lived up to my expectations . Quick service , friendly and staff was nice. Coming back for that Egusi and Fufu!

The food was good to the taste. My only concern was that as i was eating I noticed what felt like glass in the egusi and fufu. It was gritty like tiny shards of glass were in it, and i know thats not apart of the recipe. I understand people make mistakes, but next time please make sure you are being careful as your cooking the food.
Food was amazing I was in Senegal a few months ago and im so glad to be able to get the food I loved

Our friends wanted to try something new for lunch and found 5 Senses Nigerian Fusion nearby on Google. We did not research enough and learned upon arrival that they were pickup or delivery only üòÖ ‚Äì¬†no dine-in.  Chef Lola was so patient with us, and gave great recommendations on family-style platters. We ordered the herbed jollof rice, grilled chicken leg quarters, peppered turkey flats, and a stewed spinach dish. Since our order was quite large, we did have to wait about half an hour, so chef treated us with 2 boxes of fresh puff puff! These were like bite-sized Nigerian beignets, dusted with nutmeg and cinnamon sugar, and had 2 dipping options of habanero+mango and a sweet creamy glaze-like sauce. So thoughtful, and really curbed our hanger. Once we brought the food home, I did not take a great picture, because the smell was so intoxicating that we all dug right in. Everyone was super impressed with how flavorful, soulful, and filling each dish was. We had a young picky eater with us, and she ate every bite! We can't wait to try more dishes!
Food was really good a bit too spicy for me. The bread was really fantastic and the service was excellent. I did take out! The pasta is delicious and chicken really tasty.

The other reviews are giving friends/family of owner. Food is okay. I would recommend the puff puff and jollof spaghetti those taste similar to actual Nigerian food. However, they need to put salt and pepper üå∂Ô∏è in their food or somebody‚Äôs seasoning before calling it Nigerian anything.

Refrain from visiting this establishment. While I was seated in my vehicle, I observed that the staff members were not wearing gloves, were consuming food while preparing my meal, and continued to touch my food after touching their mouths. The entire process took over 45 minutes to receive my order. Ultimately, I requested a refund, as it is unreasonable for food to take such an extended time for a single person.

Food is really good. I usually order on DoorDash and it arrives warm & yummy. My only suggestion would be to allow customers to choice their spice level as the food is really spicy & can sometimes be overly. Thank you.
Been here a few times now and always reliable with satisfying my cravings. Nice workers. Good portions. Amazing flavors. Always love the Ethiopian YouTube music videos playing on the TV haha.

Had the fish cutlet and veggie combo. Definitely feels like home here. Loved the veggies felt refreshed and full. Will probably return to try the meat combo. Was nice to have a meal and watch the game on a Sunday.

Walk inside and past the convenience store to the back. On this trip I ordered their special kitfo. Previously I ordered the fish cutlet. Not my usual choices so it's hard to rate them based on other experiences. The fish cutlet was ok, bit they did let me know before hand the other fish dish is preferred.

I would say their special spinach kitfo is very good, but not better than special gomen kitfo I've had elsewhere. It is how ever more filling and comes with more spinach so you don't need to order a veggie option with it. I did order a side, but my date and I could not finish 1/3 of the food we ordered and we tried our best for maybe 45 minutes of digging in.

One thing I noticed is their injera is very thick and not as even as other places but tastes like it was made with healthier ingredients so I liked it. Just not it's not as spongy and consistent as a lot of other places. Not good or bad, just something I noticed.

Oh yea. And their water. 4 of 5. Had a bit of background taste. But barely. Our glasses were clean and yes their give you glass. Some places have dirty glasses or more more refreshing water, but im haply they are very clean here. More clean than most 4 and 5 star places, they will swear they have clean utensils, but still dirty looking. Smh, but not here.

What about the scenery. Nice. Not the best, maybe a 3.75/5 for interior and a 2/5 for the outside. It's next to autozone and a drugstore with many beggars and people lurking the lot. Makes you feel a bit uncomfortable, but not as uncomfortable as the top of international district. That area is much worse. Oh, and there is a lot of parking. Hard to find this good of parking I'm seattle.

Follows COVID-standards and is very clean. Very fragrant and yummy food. The beers came with chilled mugs and the veggie combo + fish lebled came with extra injera. Very fun atmosphere and friendly staff. We got some mitmita from the shop to take home too! 10/10 would come again.

The restaurant is located in the back. This place has the best Ethiopian food in town! Pictured here is the veggie combo. I‚Äôve never had food so fragrant and filling. They give you extra injera bread for takeaway. All of this food was about $15, which was quite generous. You can watch the music videos on the TV while you wait for your food. :)

name: Union N Eritrean and Ethiopian bar and Restaurant

reviews.text:
I called to complain about my food
The owner hung up.in my face.
I've tasted Ethiopia food before.
This had no flavor
The waitresses were rude. The owner hung up in my face
I will.never go back there again
No flavor
No flavor
Cabbage ends hard
What they serving
Loud atmosphere
No customers eating
Instead of the owner
Trying telling me to bring food back he hung up in my face
I like Ethiopia food
In comments name a good decent place
Never Ever go back to that HOLE IN THE WALL.
HORTIBLE EXPERIENCE.
I've been real sick
This was a big mistake. $ 23.00
For some cold hard cabbage and hard peas. Don't know what else that was.
So Dissatisfied.

Stopped here on my way home after a late night out. Was pleasantly surprised to find them not only open, but still serving a full menu up until 1:00am. It's not my favorite Ethiopian spot but definitely on the list due to their hours.

I‚Äôve been a regular at this establishment, but my recent visits have left me quite frustrated. First and foremost, the noise level is consistently overwhelming. Every time I walk in, the music is blaring, making it difficult to enjoy my meal or have a conversation.

Additionally, I‚Äôve felt undervalued as a customer. On my last visit, I noticed a discrepancy between the menu prices and what I was charged. When I brought this to the attention of the staff, I was informed that the prices on the menu were outdated and that they would be updating them next week. This lack of transparency is concerning, especially since I often choose to spend my money here.

I truly hope the management takes these issues seriously!
The food was so good, just the right spice for the lamb tibs and the customer service was amazing such an amazing staff. I highly recommend coming to this place

The food was 4,5 days old, need's to be fresh to be surved and also the services is very poor there was no one there, after we left 3 of us vomited. They don't even deserve   a rate if I could I will give them -1 worst Food, worst service.

only $23 for the massive plate!!! DELICIOUS!!
such a calm, beautifully decorated place, with diverse food. the meat is cooked so well. also try their meat with jerky in it (second picture) the texture is amazing
The food is amazing and there's so much variety in a plate! Filling, flavorful, and not expensive. We had a great time there and will be visiting again. Wonderful place :)

I am giving this such a high review because the pasta was AMAZING!!!! But the other food was definitely cooked in a rush and not cooked over many hours. The injera was quite dry and thin. The atmosphere was awkward as it was completely empty. The service was kind, but the food took forever to come out which really pushed me to think that it was definitely made last minute and not spent cooking and stewing through the day. I will definitely be back for the pasta though. The price was okay but for the small amount of meat in the pasta it was a bit expensive, but so good that I will be back.

I'm normally never out this way, and the two restaurants besides this one we're closed at the time. So what the hell, let's try something new!! The people outside and inside looked like they were enjoying themselves. So you order at the front counter your food and drinks. Take your number they give you to a table of your preference and wait. The ambiance of this place is super cool. One part of the restaurant is like a bike shop, if I remember correctly. It didn't take long for my Kimchi Bloody Mary to show up. Yes it sounds weird but it was damn good!!!! As some may know I love a good BLT!! This is not your regular smegular BLT. Wow of wow was it fresh and delicious. I finished that plate like I was starving!! I wanted another bloody Mary but I was driving home, so no bueno!! And don't be lazy put your own dishes away! Oh well til next time. Oh yes the bathrooms are clean
They have the best texture of injera in Seattle, my favorite.
Meats were good I thought the vegetable dishes were lacking. Amazing atmosphere I‚Äôd come back with my friends for drinks and snacks. Cool how the place is open til 2am

Blue Nile Ethiopian Restaurant is hands down one of the best dining experiences I‚Äôve ever had. The flavors are authentic, rich, and unforgettable ‚Äî every bite feels like a celebration of Ethiopian culture. The food is simply top-tier.

Open late, felt super authentic, and was absolutely fantastic. I got the veggie platter (to go) & had intended to save some for leftovers but it was so delicious none made it to the fridge. Really fun atmosphere and everybody inside (diners and staff) were so friendly. Would love to go again next time we‚Äôre in Seattle!

We had a friend take us here to share his culture with us and it was an amazing experience. The food was incredible. The portions were extremely generous. The three of us ordered three entrees and there was so much left over to take home. The sauces, beef, and injera were all so delicious. Parking is tricky but it‚Äôs worth it.

Best injera I‚Äôve had so far, I‚Äôve tried a couple places but I just keep coming back to Blue Nile. Great and polite customer service. The music is always greats and sets a really atmosphere in the restaurant. I would highly recommend this Ethiopian restaurant!

Great place for a delicious dinner!  Ras Dashen Ethiopian Restaurant is a great place for a group discussion while eating dinner! I usually go there with my friends after an event and the food is always great! The hospitality and the space is A+. Sometimes, I also go there just eat great food in a quiet space.

We ordered the qanta firfir and asa dulet, and both were outstanding! This family-owned restaurant serves some of the freshest and lightest Ethiopian food I‚Äôve had. The flavors are authentic, delicious, and not heavy at all.
Highly recommend Ra Dash to anyone in Seattle looking for amazing Ethiopian cuisine!

We had a wonderful dining experience at Ras Dashen Ethiopian Restaurant. From the moment I arrived, everything exceeded my expectations. The food was absolutely delicious  rich in flavor, beautifully presented, and full of authentic Ethiopian taste. Each dish was clearly prepared with care and attention to detail.
The service was excellent. The staff were warm, welcoming, and attentive, making sure everything was perfect throughout the meal. Their friendliness and knowledge of the menu made the experience even more enjoyable.
The atmosphere was vibrant and full of energy, reflecting the warmth of Ethiopian culture. To make the evening even more special, the owner personally came by to greet us incredibly friendly and engaging, even joining in to dance with us, which made the experience unforgettable.
Overall, Ras Dashen Ethiopian Restaurant offers an outstanding combination of delicious food, excellent service, and a joyful atmosphere. I highly recommend it and can‚Äôt wait to visit again soon!
Delicious spiced tea, a prodigious veggie combo platter, and natural lighting with jazzy tunes to boot. Love the gluten free teff options
These best Ethiopian food I have ever had, simply delicious üòã 10/10 a must try. This was my first time trying Ethiopian Latte so good.

This was my first time trying Ethiopian food, and I am so glad I came to Zagol. My friend‚Äôs family member, who is from Eritrea, told me I would love it and they were right. The place was cozy, the server was kind and welcoming, and the food was absolutely delicious.

I do not remember the name of the dish, but it was full of flavor and beautifully presented. I loved learning to eat with my hands and sharing from the same plate. The injera bread was amazing, soft, and perfect for the experience.

Zagol made my first time unforgettable. I will definitely come back every time I visit Seattle.

Zero star. This was one of the worst dining experiences I‚Äôve ever had. First of all, we found a stone in our food ‚Äî yes, an actual stone.  But it gets worse. The waiter completely ignored us the entire time ‚Äî not a single check-in, no apology, nothing. We sat there for 45 minutes waiting for food that showed up cold, stale, and clearly not fresh. The staff couldn‚Äôt care less, and the whole interaction felt like we were an inconvenience to them. No warmth, no accountability, just pure indifference. Absolutely disgraceful. Never, ever go to this place.

Extremely disappointing experience. The waiter barely acknowledged our table, no service, no water refills the entire time. After a 45-minute wait, we were served stale food. Worst part: I found a stone in my dish and nearly broke a tooth. Completely unacceptable. Will not be returning.
Great food and the sever was nice, I really liked their shiro the most, their misir wot was just okay but overall I loved the veggie combo.

I had come here to explore the Ethiopian cuisine and I have to say the experience was amazing. Based on the previous reviews here, I ordered the vegetarian combo and it exceeded my expectations. Its not any kind of fancy food, but simple food prepared well. The combo had around nine separate portions of lentils, beetroot, beans, cabbage preparations. This might sound so basic and a everyday home food, but you need to give it a shot. The bread was soft and flavorful. I also ordered the lamb tibbs and it was good, the meat was tender and well cooked. This was more than a sufficient for two people at a reasonable price of less than $50. The service was great too. The waitress did a very good job of quickly attending us and explaining the menu since this was my first time and also provided their recommendations. You will find plenty of vegetarian and vegan options on the menu. I liked how the payment was to be made using a QR code from your own phone. There is ample parking around in the residential area. The food has now encouraged me to try some other Ethiopian restaurants however will definitely be back here. My only disappointment was they do not have any desert option on the menu.
The firfir is literally full of jalape√±os , and some of the items in the veggie combo has funny taste to it
Our favorite eithopian place in Seattle. I love that the meat can come spicy. Great portions and just amazing. I can't wait to try more things.

The atmosphere and food here is outstanding. The decor and setting is simple yet traditional, rounded out with the sweet smell of frankincense incense. The dishes are flavorfully spiced and the lamb is delicious! I highly recommend this spot!

I can confidently say that this is the best Ethiopian restaurant in Seattle. I have been visiting for a long time, and over the last four years, the food quality, atmosphere, and service have remained unchanged‚Ä¶ the consistency is amazing. Each dish bursts with authentic flavors that transport me straight to back Home, and the injera is always perfectly soft and tangy. The staff greets you like family, making every visit feel like a warm reunion. Even during busy hours, they manage to maintain a level of attentiveness that is hard to find elsewhere. I often recommend this gem to friends, and they always leave raving about their experience.
Delicious Ethiopian food! Loved the greens in the meat combo and very large portions, but I do wish the injera was a bit warmer.
Africanita! The best of the best in Seattle. I was very happy to shop at the store. And I appreciate the welcome from the staff.
Good place to be friendly and very kind they speak so many languages I love it I would like to go again
This was my first experience and Horrible customer service. No welcome at all the lady was on the phone all the time. Ask a question where products are just point and look you up and down.
Very friendly customer service!!
Unique selection and friendly üòÅ

I recently visited this Nigerian restaurant and overall had a good experience, though there were a few bumps along the way. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the music set a really nice vibe that made the evening enjoyable. The food itself was very good‚Ä¶full of flavor and definitely worth coming back for.

That said, the service was a bit confusing. The restaurant uses a self-service system, but it seemed to be missing some options that should have been available. We briefly spoke to a server, but they disappeared after a quick exchange, leaving us unsure of how to proceed. Eventually, I believe it was the bartender who ended up taking our order, and they were very kind and helpful, which I appreciated.

So while the start of the experience felt a little disorganized, the food and the overall atmosphere made up for it. With a few improvements to the service and ordering process, this place could be excellent.

Been here twice, and the food has been really good on both occasions.

The first time we had it in was in March. The ogbono and egusi had tripes and pomo in them, and we added extra proteins to the order for extra charge.

Next time was in May. (2 months apart)
I noticed the soups didn‚Äôt have tripes or cow skin in them, which is very okay with me since the chicken this time was bigger than the first time.

We also had the Jollof as take outs.

Overall, the food is really good, and it is worth eating here.

This place checks all the boxes of an African restaurant in a good way. Ordering is made simple with being able to order off your phone. So you can take your time going over the menu. They have an easily accessible sink to wash your hand, the music and set up help with the atmosphereüëåüèæ. We had Okra, fufu, chicken stew, plantain and jollof with goat meat. It took like 5-7 minutes after ordering and our food was out like all items. To top it off the food was really really good hand down authentic.

The food is lacking the flavors of slow cooked authentic Nigerian food.  Tasted like concoction.  Jollof tasted like box Spanish rice with stew added.  Fried rice tasted like maggi. The zobo tasted like canned pineapple juice, very metallic, no traditional flavors.  Everything about the suya was wrong. Goat meat and stew base was just okay. The portions are small for the price.  Either lower the prices or serve a 17.00 serving of rice. Clean and open place. There is work needed here.

Had intended to get here many times, finally made it. Found them on the Alaska Airlines mileage site. The positives are, the goat was solid. The location is convenient and accessible, space is clean and well-furnished. On the flipside, a little pricey for the portion size, but then again it's been decades since I've had goat, so I'm unfamiliar with the costs. It has a lot of potential, and I think they can improve on being more welcoming. Offer some events to bring more people in. I also think they're leaving money on the table being closed on Sunday during baseball season, but I saw that one Sunday per month they have a brunch event.  I'll check it out at some point.

I usually go for veggie combos so apologies, can‚Äôt speak much to the meat dishes. By no means is this a fancy place, but it has everything you‚Äôd need! If you like places that feel homey, this hits those vibes on the head. The server/host was friendly and quick, and she advised we go for the Shiro Wot.

The Shiro Wot is soooo good. I haven‚Äôt had this dish before in typical Ethiopian veggie combos so we ordered this on the side and it was the highlight!

Portions were generous, food was quick to be prepared, and I will certainly be back.

First of all, the food was AMAZING. It had just the right flavors and it tasted so hand-made which I love. For the price, we were fed SO much. They kept refilling our anjeer bread and we had plenty of leftovers left. The service was super nice. I loved this place. Lots of vegetarian options too. 10/10 recommend.

I had a strong appetite for Eastern African cuisine and searched somewhere in the Seattle area with good ratings. My husband and I got lucky that the day we checked out this restaurant, they were celebrating a family activity. It was very endearing how they welcomed and serviced us, even bringing us cake from their celebration.

It felt aesthetically unassuming and their customer service was very attentive and sweet. We appreciated their help when going over the menu and selecting the right options. We went with a softer textured meat (can‚Äôt remember the name of the plate) and the Veggie Combo.

My husband cannot eat very spicy food, so finding less spicy food options can be a bit tricky. For example, please note that the salad comes with jalape√±os. This would have been good to know in advance since we did not expect that.

They have a section with a pool table. Again, quite modest in aesthetic but it looks like it is a family-friendly option where they put on their own celebratory events.

Very worth a try.

Unfortunately not the best. I used to come here a lot when Chef owned the establishment so maybe my expectations were higher than they should have been. Musty grandma like smell throughout the restaurant. Injera was microwaved and soggy. Veggie combo had two out of seven stews that were acceptable. Fried fish recipe completely changed, no authentic hot sauce received sriracha. Will not come back. Waitress was nice and aware that food is not the same.
Welcomed us and let us eat even though we were the only ones in the restaurant. Best Ethiopian food I‚Äôve ever had.

I had always wanted to try Ethiopian cuisine and this place leaves me wanting more. The owner was very excited to inform us on what to get and how it‚Äôs usually eaten. We both ate the veggie combo family style and shared a bottle of honey wine. Plenty of food with varying depths of flavor. The place also felt very laid back and homey. It was money and time well spent.

While walking around, I noticed the "Open" sign, and as soon as I stepped into the restaurant, I knew the food would be delicious. The ingredients tasted incredibly fresh and of high quality, and most importantly, the flavors were so tasty, even though they were new to me. The owner took the time to explain how to eat the injera, making me feel very welcome. She also shared the history of the restaurant with me. This was my first time trying Ethiopian cuisine, and I loved it! I visited alone, but I plan to invite some friends because the restaurant's vibe is cozy and warm, and sharing food with loved ones makes it even more tasty.
This is the best lamb and veggie platter I've ever had in Seattle. The owner is super kind and gracious as well. I highly recommend for locals!

Absolutely fantastic! We've been looking for our next favorite Ethiopian restaurant and i think we've found it! The serving was generous, the dishes were both comforting and flavorful. We ordered the veggie combo with the Yebere Tibbs and it's a great way to sample the variety they have to offer. The staff were warm and welcoming. Whether you're new to Ethiopian cuisine or a longtime fan, this spot is a must-visit. A true gem!
Great experience.  Food was tasty, owner spent alot of time talking about the dishes and even brought certain spices out for us to taste (we cook Ethiopian at home alot).
I did not like the inside vibe but the food is really good. Especially I liked their flat bread.

I ordered food from them from Uber $27 plus $18 shipping 40 something dollars to get my food here for the combination plate and they lowkey scammed me out of my money and gave me meat combination which is cheaper. I called them four times and they didn‚Äôt answer. I called them again and they hung up in my face after saying they were gonna talk to the kitchen. Never called back

Food was delicious and very authentic. Service only suffered because of language barriers. Decor and furniture could definitely use some taste and updates but the people were all very friendly and welcoming despite cultural differences.

It was a late night tonight and we were hungry and discovered that this place was open for delivery. The food arrived and as we started eating.We were mind-blown and how delicious it was. Specifically the collard greens!!! How is this food so good within a few miles for me and I was unaware? I will definitely come here again.
Very nice üëçüèø place I love the kitfoo it‚Äôs so delicious the dry tibs ohh yem go and enjoy the with the most beautiful service

Discover the vibrant flavors of East Africa‚Äîright here in Minneapolis!

Taste of East African invites you on a culinary adventure filled with bold spices, rich aromas, and unforgettable dishes. Sip on fragrant African Chai, savor the tender, perfectly seasoned Rice with Goat, and enjoy the comforting classic Ugali with mouthwatering Goat Mea - each bite crafted with authentic tradition and passion.

Whether you're grabbing a quick meal or planning a flavorful feast, you can easily order online and pick up at the restaurant. Parking is convenient, with meters on Lake Street and free neighborhood parking nearby.

Join the many fans who keep this spot buzzing with energy and great food. Friendly service, incredible flavors - come experience the Taste of East African for yourself!

The food was very delicious, and was a good introduction to East African cuisine. The service was extremely good. Everybody was super helpful, especially with guiding me and my friends through the menu. Would recommend if you are looking for some good, local food in the area.

ridiculously tasty food, wonderful service, the kindest waiter and cook, extremely attentive, insanely affordable for how full we got. Home made fruit drinks were tasty too. A family business with great food and kind ppl so well worth supporting. Will 100% be coming back with more friends next time

We ordered the family-style platter with meats and salmon, and it was an absolute feast‚Äîflavorful, well-seasoned, and perfect for sharing. The goat, beef, chicken, and salmon were all cooked beautifully, and the sides (rice, chapati, and soor) tied everything together.

The owner was clearly overwhelmed today on 4 July  with a visiting team of athletes, but he still made a huge effort to take care of everyone. One of our dishes was delayed by about an hour, but he was upfront about it and kindly comped it. That level of hospitality is rare.

The space is no-frills‚Äîa classic hole-in-the-wall‚Äîbut the food and the owner‚Äôs warmth more than make up for it. If you‚Äôre looking for East African food and genuine service, this place is well worth a visit.

In the picture is $15 of fantastic African food! The chef/owner was above and beyond making sure everything was in order. Also wanted feedback on the food to know what he could do better. I'm not a local, but if I where, I'd definitely come back!

This was my second time at this restaurant. I got home and my first bite had a hair in it. I thought maybe it was a hair from my house maybe I touched my hair or something. I kept eating closely inspecting every bite and there was ANOTHER HAIR. I called and spoke with the owner and he told me there was nothing he could do because I had left the restaurant and anything could have happened.  Which basically says I‚Äôm lying. He offered no concession and no refund

Such amazing service.  They are amazing chefs. So glad they have a business here. I love the Ewedu soup absolutely amazing the flavor is so good. Literally my favorite food.  Amazing fufu  the soup is delicious.  ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Great owner, I‚Äôve known him since he was over on University by Earths beauty supply. He always makes me feel like I‚Äôm talking to a family friend. The food was amazing and made in a timely manner. I wish he did have more grocery but that will come with time. üôåüèæ

Stopped in for some soups and was not disappointed! We tried the efo riro and egusi. Both with fufu. The flavors were amazing, though I might ask for a bit more heat next time. Egusi is one of my favorites, and they nailed it. The guy taking orders was also very friendly and made us feel welcome. I'm so excited to finally have good West African food in St. Paul! If you're in the mood for something amazing, definitely check this place out.
Their African foods are delicious! The Afang is superb üëå! Love everything they have in there. Love their services! Friendly people.
Has to be the worst food and service in town It has a very distinct obnoxious odor. I was lucky to not get food poisoning. Stay away from this disgusting place. Clearly the reviews here are stacked

Wanted to try something new. Walked into a "local" bonding, hole-in-wall vibe restaurant. Had no idea what any of the items on menu were. Staff explained what dishes consisted of. Went with the KK with chicken. Was able to sit and pay later. They brought food to our table and gave complimentary cokes and waters for us. Staff said they wanted us to "have a good experience and come back". I absolutely loved the food and we cleaned the plate fast! Also, they did not force a tip after paying. Definitely go! And experience amazing hospitality and great food

The steak suqaar was amazing. The chicken KK was too bit bland and sweet for me. A half size plate is still really big and filling! They gave us bananas for free as an appetizer which was super nice! The staff was so nice and we got everything despite our language barrier. Would 1000% recommend for the suqaar!
The food was amazing! If you‚Äôre a fan of trying different ethnic foods, I recommend you come here.
Authentic and the best Somalian food in town. A must try. Exquisite food.
First time ordering and they canceled my order for delivery without letting me know why won‚Äôt be ordering again

Came here almost a year ago. It was my first time at an Ethiopian restaurant, and I was impressed with the flavors of everything. I ordered the three meat dish to share with a friend. There was enough to bring some home. I will have to visit again soon.

ethiopian food in minnesota is better becous of bole! hands down from the food to service as well as the set up! I recomend the vegie plater im sure you will love it! my friend had the kitfo and he wont stop talking about it.

First timer with Ethiopian cuisine, I thought the food was awesome.  Great flavors and colors, the plate itself was beautiful.  I couldn‚Äôt tell you the name of anything we ate but the gentleman at the counter was extremely helpful with recommendations, proper technique when eating, and checked in on us several times.  Food was cheap, $21 for 2 and brought home leftovers.  Really nice experience overall and will go back!

I had a great experience here!

I like how you can order a variety of portion sizes. There is a good variety of meet and vegetable options. The menu was very well organized and easy to understand. I decided to order a ‚Äúlight size‚Äù of the lamb stew, which comes with 3 rolls of injera and salad. I also ordered beef sambusas. The light order of lamb stew was a great deal for $9! Not only did it fill me up, it was so tender! I have never had lamb so tender. The sambusas were crispy and fresh tasting. The dipping sauce tasted homemade too. Looking forward to trying more on the menu.

Also, the owners and staff were very friendly. They made sure we were comfortable and knew how to eat the food.

10/10‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®
Kind of an odd restaurant but love the food. My son and daughter-in-law love this place but my wife does not into Ethiopian food so she won't try it anymore. But I love it.

I've seen different ratings from different food servicing platforms and wanted to try it out myself because it was the closest to me. I was pretty disappointed. I ordered the egusi soup with pounded yam 24 oz for $28.99 with extra pepper for $1. First thing I noticed was I did not get my extra pepper kala. It was $1 so, whatever. Food looked good but my first bite in was lacking a lot of flavor. It was bland and almost tasted a little bitter. Curious about the bitterness, I poked around and can see what it looks like to be burnt bottom pieces? For the meat, I can see that its all bony stewing hen pieces. Possibly the worst meat to eat as they are tougher and dryer with littlw to no meat. I wanted to like it but have to admit, this was the worst egusi soup I've had. I've had better egusi soup that came out of a 10oz container with no meat at all and was satisfied with the affordable price. For almost $30, it is not worth it. I'd tip extra to have my food delivered from outside of the area.
The food was SO good! We got the potato leaf and jallof rice. She even let me sample the cassava leaf and potato leaf before I decided. Grace is so nice!
Such a delightful and tasty spot! Super friendly staff, expertly seasoned and freshly fried chicken, and cozy jollof rice. Warm smiles and hot food, will definitely be coming back here ü•∞

I love the food, I called in about 9pm about to Close, after I called in and she waited on me, when she was about to leave, great place over hands down., services was great.  Great food. The food is cook fresh and ready. I will recommend this place by any time when you get to Minneapolis check it out.
She was so nice and made sure it was up to par. She let me check the food to take sure it was the correct. The food tasted amazing and made fresh

name: Dukem Ethiopian Restaurant, Sports Bar & Lounge

reviews.text:
I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect before visiting ‚Äî I thought it might be more of a sports bar or club ‚Äî but it turned out to be a great restaurant with delicious food at very reasonable prices.

The atmosphere was welcoming, and the staff (and guests) were all very kind, which made our experience even better.

My only small critique is that there was incense burning during our visit, which gave off a strong smell. It seemed like it may have been covering up tobacco smoke, though we didn‚Äôt actually see anyone smoking inside.

Overall, the food, value, and friendly vibe make this place one I‚Äôd definitely recommend!

EDIT: Rating is still a STRONG 5, but now I have been here and eaten here multiple times.  Recently I came here on a Saturday afternoon.
This place is packed on Saturdays, lots of activity, lots of TVs with multiple sports playing, and a very fun and boisterous crowd.  Despite the crowd, service was still prompt and everyone was super nice.
Just give it a try!

Original:  It took me way too long to give this place a try. I walked in and was greeted at the bar with a smile, and a cold glass of water.
I was just in to get some food to go but grabbed a beer while I waited. It was served ice cold in a nice glass.
The menu has a great selection of items and everything sounds delicious. Ended up getting the ZilZil tibs and would highly recommend that dish.
I‚Äôm very happy with the taste, quality and portion I received for the price, and cannot wait to come back and work my way through their menu.
Also, if you are into espresso drinks, definitely come by and give this a try, their set up is impressive.

A neat place tucked away. I was here before volunteering for a community event and the staff were incredibly kind/helpful. The food they offered was fantastic and it was a fun atmosphere. I'll definitely be back, so 5 stars from me!

They are very slow one staff you wait very long time to get your food. You wait very long time to order. It‚Äôs just not a good customer service. I was very disappointed. I came with my dad is very sad. We couldn‚Äôt eat for like two hours. we‚Äôre waiting and then we have to leave. I will never come back to this place again

Food looks really good and smelled wonderful. I am a chef. I did not order any but I will be back soon to try it. Atmosphere....the large tables with ornate chairs are unique to a sports bar. The people there were very kind and welcoming. There was nowhere to sit except a few empty chairs at tables with patrons. I was offered a seat at many tables. I was the only white person there to watch a soccer match and I felt welcomed to be there. Beer was cold and crisp and only $4 dollars for a Summit Saga. Service was awesome.

Absolute must. I got the half beef and half veggie. It was an absurd amount of food and reasonably priced. Some of the best Ethiopian food of hot. Bring a big appetite. They were super fast. I'd absolutely recommend this.

My server helped me look through the menu which was super helpful since this was my first time trying Ethiopian food. She recommended the Shiro which wasn‚Äôt too spicy and I loved it. If you do like spicy food, it comes served with jalape√±os so you can adjust that. I did notice it was a much smaller portion than the Misir my friend ordered, but still plenty of food.

Went for dinner with friends.  Got the spicy beef tibs.  Super tasty and savory.  Friends got the meat sampler platter every was amazing.  Only reason why I didn't give 5 stars was the bathrooms were dirty and needed some attention.  Besides that great service and amazing food.  Would recommend.

The food was fantastic!! We had the veggie platter and the veggie&meat platter and they were both so delicious. I‚Äôll be thinking about this food for months. The atmosphere was really warm and felt very authentic. Would definitely come back again.

Enjoyed the "Veggie Combo and Meat Combo" house special at Agelgil Ethiopian Restaurant‚Äîtons of delicious, authentic Ethiopian food that could easily feed three, and it's very affordable too! They're known for their cozy atmosphere and attentive service, enhancing the dining experience. Open until midnight, it's perfect for a late dinner. Wasn't sure about the billing process, so we checked out at the counter. Overall, a fantastic and economical dining experience!
The food was good and staff were welcoming. We had a good time there! Jollof rice, fried rice, okra soup and swallow were all so delicious.

I really enjoyed my time here! The hostess was nice and was informative of the food. I tried the egusi soup and fufu. It was very good, chicken was very tender. I will come back to this place and try the cassava leaf!

I placed an order online, I read all the reviews and figured I‚Äôd give it a try and I was not let down. The food was delicious and flavorful, egusi and fufu. Wow, next time I‚Äôll definitely dine in and get the full experience. But yes I‚Äôd go back again. Thank you.

The food is absolutely out of this world, I recommend the Egusi Soup & fufu. Service is great and friendly as well. It feels just like picking up a plate of food from your mom‚Äôs place. Nice big portion as well, pint of the soup and about a softball size ball of  fufu.

I ordered the cassava leaf and it was not good at all. I couldn‚Äôt even force myself to continue to eat it. Not what I was expecting at all and I asked for beef and smoked turkey but I got smoked turkey and chicken. I would not spend my money here again. If you want good African food..go to African deli on Brooklyn blvd and it‚Äôs cheaper there ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

name: Dilla Sports Bar and Ethiopian Restaurant

reviews.text:
I have past this place many times. Today I stopped for dinner. I was seated immediately. Service was fast. Love the traditional Ethiopian atmosphere and music.
A big thanks to my service provider Tsion was fantastic.
I had the Sambusas for appetizers. I received 5 of them with sauce. Other places only give you three. Very delicious with a a good spicey taste. Then had the Dilla Sandwich with a side of fries. The sandwich was with beef, bell peppers, jalape√±os, red onions and a bit of mayo on a sub style bread. It was absolutely delicious.

Hands down worthy of a return visit. They have a nice bar as well. A must visit business.

This is my favorite Ethiopian restaurant! The doro wot is absolutely delicious, the service is always so friendly, and the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to enjoy authentic Ethiopian food in a cozy setting.

It‚Äôs hard to find delicious veggies. But I found them at Dilla. I got the veggie combo plate which includes a little of about 7 different vegetarian dishes, and baklava for dessert. It was possibly the best baklava that I‚Äôve ever had.

Came here on a Saturday night as a good neighborhood option for dinner. Pricing is a little higher than other Ethiopian restaurants but the setup is nice.

When we were here their air conditioning did not work and there were big fans all over the place. It was warm but comfortable.

The food was good but our server forgot to bring our injera bread out and we were confused as to how to eat our food without injera bread.

It's an ok place and a good alternative to the food in this neighborhood but if you want better food and service you'll probably want to go somewhere else.

I had an incredible experience at Dilla sports and Ethiopian Restaurant. From start to finish, everything was awesome. The food was absolutely amazing perfectly prepared and full of flavor. On top of that, the service was exceptional. Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and made the evening even more enjoyable. I highly recommend this place for a special occasion or just a fantastic meal. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

name: Eatwell Philly - African Restaurant and Lounge

reviews.text: I‚Äôm Puerto Rican with mostly Nigerian DNA (25% Nigerian. Everything else is 15 or less). The food is tasty. The rice isn't the same texture as traditional Puerto Rican, But the soul of the flavor is definitely there

Everything felt incredibly authentic and well done! The waitress helped up go through the menu and choose things that interest us without ordering in excess. I personally like my fufu on the side and not under everything. Some of the meats just weren‚Äôt my cup of tea but i‚Äôm sure others will like it. We recommend the Suya

First time trying Nigerian food. I took Efo Elegusi meal and jollof rice, I loved it. Food was so good. Good service and nice atmosphere (good music, not too loud). The place is very neat, I highly recommand.

Stopped into Eatwell for lunch and had a great experience! The food was fantastic, particularly the spicy suya, meat pies, and jollof rice. The menu was quite extensive, so there are plenty of options and we look forward to trying new things. It was our first time eating here, but the service was pleasant and helpful in explaining things on the menu. Overall, a great time!

I was walking when I spotted this place. I was excited to check it out as I am African and wanted to support an African restaurant. The Suya was a little dry to me, but I did still enjoy it. The puff puff was definitely worth it. The restaurant was clean and it wasn't too loud. I definitely recommend checking them out.

I was pleasantly surprised to see a West African Restaurant on City Line Ave. I was not surprised that their food was ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!! Before I walked around the corner, I could feel the aroma wafting through the breeze as if it had my nose targeted. As soon as I walked in, I was greeted with the most beautiful smile. The menu was right there on the wall and I paid hard earned money for high quality food! I've been back 3 times already and tomorrow will be the forth!

If you want a place to get Nigerian food, you just hit the jackpot. I had egusi soup, jollof rice, suya and meatpie, and I had absolutely no complaints.
The service, from the moment I called, was friendly, welcoming, and very courteous. Felt like meeting an old friend.
Food portions were generous, and the suya was divine.
My only complaint would be the amount of oil in the egusi, it was too much. But that's just me. Some may like it that way

My absolute favorite place for lunch near SJU! The jollof wrap is a must-try, and the chicken suya bowl with high heat and Okuko rice is unbelievably good. The staff is super friendly, and the whole place has a great vibe.

Were do I begin! I have restaurants that I believe are good to very good. I thought this restaurant was exceptional! So Let‚Äôs Dish! Customer Service was patient and informative as this was our first time in a West African restaurant. He did everything with a generous smile. The place where they were cooking was clean and organized. Now the food, clean, wonderful spices, and plentiful! The vegetables tasted like they were made in heaven! The plantains were a perfect sweet but not too sweet balance. Rice cooked perfectly. And my friend ate all the cornbread üò±.  I can‚Äôt wait to go try everything on the menu. The steak was slightly over cooked but the seasoning was on point. Run don‚Äôt walk to this place!

This food is D E L I C I O U S. Fresh, flavorful, and affordable. Clearly marked vegan options which is always important to me.  I got the student bowl in the early afternoon and was full literally all day. Service was friendly, quick, and passionate. Nice music. A gem. Will deff be back! Thank you Suya Suya.

My first time trying Nigerian food, it was amazing! Employees are friendly and patient.. Hot and fresh food, I tried the egusi with fufu .. it‚Äôs empty in here but that could be because the closing time says Saturday 6pm .. it‚Äôs 8:50 now .. it‚Äôs a nice welcoming place, I‚Äôd come back.

I was in PA and wanted some authentic Nigerian food. I found this resturant and decided to give it a try the food was great very flavorful and great portions. Price was also reasonable plenty parking. I would most definitely say if you are in the area to stop by and give it a try! The resturant is on the second floor inside SA Cafe!
Ordered jollof with stew and chicken and this is the best Nigerian food I‚Äôve had in Philly by far. The meat could be softer but it was still tasty. The jollof and stew were extremely flavorful.

amazing food and service! will definitely be back. the restaurant is tucked away on the second floor and we almost thought we were in the wrong place - so glad we still stopped in because the food was delicious. we got the suya, egusi soup, and jollof rice with bone in lamb, and i would highly recommend each dish. the portion sizes were very generous and the service was great.
The food was amazing. The lamb may have been the best I have ever had. Jolof rice was also delicious. I‚Äôll definitely go back again.

Lemandingue is one of the best African restaurant in Philadelphia the food is always delicious. I have been eating at this restaurant for couple of years but the food has been a savior for me because there‚Äôs no way that I will cook on my own if I can spend less than $20 and get the best of the best.

Ordered delivery and the food did not disappoint. Everything was delicious. This was the lamb with jollof rice, side of plantain and side of cabbage. The cabbage i wasn‚Äôt crazy about (too soft no crunch) but everything else was very good and would order again. They give you plenty of food. I believe the prices are fair for the amount of food you receive.
Food was good but it wasn‚Äôt what I ordered. Never had African food the fufu and egosi was good ordered red snapper jollof rice and plantain but I know damn well this isn‚Äôt jollof rice !

I‚Äôm not sure if they got a new cook but the fact I had to season my cassava leaf is crazy. The rice is too mushy, I can literally mash the rice up. This was my go to spot for potatoe greens and cassava. I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs going on with the cook from back then compared to the cook now but you guys desperately need a change. My past 6 orders have been BLAND and the rice is overcooked, it‚Äôs laziness on the cooks part because why isn‚Äôt the food simply seasoned? You guys need a new cook, get back to being the best African restaurant in Philly!

I drive from jersey and get the fufu and egusi. I used to come all the time BUT the egusi used to be waaaaay to spicy so I stopped coming. Yesterday, my man said let‚Äôs try them again but this time let‚Äôs get a bottle of milk to eliminate the spice lolol well we went back after 6months and there was no spiciness in it THANK YOOOOU!!! We will be back again every week now. That spice was too much for us before but this time was perfect.

We decided to dine in, and I have to say this place blew me away. From the start, the service was warm and welcoming. They brought out complimentary coffee and donuts, which were absolutely delicious and set the tone for the meal. When the food arrived, I had the Yassa with fish‚Äîand wow, it was hands down one of the best meals I‚Äôve had in a long time. Everything was fresh, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. Between the incredible food, the amazing coffee, and the top-notch service, I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

First time having Senegalese food -- but not the last! Got a dish called Yassa -- chicken, flavorful cooked onions, and rice. Amazing flavor. Also got a super fresh salad to start, and a really flavorful coffee. Constant flow of people coming in or taking out, so obviously a neighborhood gem I was missing out on. Staff was super nice too. Coming back for the lamb next time!

This is my first time trying Senegalese food. I got the lamb dibi with jollof and plantain. I spent around $23. The portion was fine. The lamb was delicious, and a hint of mustard. The plantain was very sweet, just a tad too greasy for my liking. The rice was my least favorite. Maybe it was the type of rice they used, I didn‚Äôt like the texture, it also didn‚Äôt have that much flavor.

This is my third time ordering from this store. The first time my order was correct. The second time I received different items then what was asked for over the phone and did not realize until I came home. This time I order a milk like pur√©e that has black beans in it. Unknown to me, I thought this was the same item I‚Äôve purchased from other ethnic African restaurants. I had bought 4 of these totaling $20 dollars. Even while in the store one of the products I had asked for I was told was a Guinean pur√©e. I felt as though if the items I listed were Guinean they should‚Äôve made me aware that the item I was getting was not the same as what they were selling. I tried calling upon eating the first bowl to resolve the issues of me mistaking a dish I commonly eat to theirs. The gentleman who answer couldn‚Äôt seem to understand how a simple mishap could have took place when similar dishes are served in Africa especially west Africa. He was very  ignorant and arrogant to tell me ‚Äúthat this was not a Guinean store‚Äù but still proceed to go through with the purchase I thought was similar to the Guinean purchase I usually buy. Will be disputing this charge because the other 3 items will have to be discarded. I was not informed of a no refund policy by this man who answered or anything just pure ignorance when I called.

Recently used the catering service everything went smoothly. Grateful for the care and intention that Ngone brought to every detail and answering every phone calls (even during her day off). The price was affordable and the food was amazing. Don't take my words for it go check it out you will not regret it.

name: Le Mandingue African Restaurant Upper Darby

reviews.text: I drove over an hour due to hearing good things only to be given the wrong platter. I ordered lamb and was given tilapia. When I called to see if they would have take a remake another day the staff member female was rude told me to bring back the food when explained I lived over an hour away she hung up the phone. I had to call more than 7 times before a ‚Äúmanager‚Äù got on the phone. This is poor poor customer service. If that was not bad enough when picking up my food I used the bathroom and there was not soap in the bathroom. I should have known then to cancel the order and run far far away. I mean how are the employees being sanitary after using the bathroom . Absolutely unacceptable!

This place has completely fallen off, I ordered food from here several times in the past but my last two experiences have been horrible. Today 12/7/24 I ordered palava Sauce and my dish was very dry with no taste, no flavor and so sauce. They typically put different types of meat in sauce but today was only chicken. My rice was extremely overcooked and very mushy. It was so bad that I couldn‚Äôt bring myself to eat any of it. I will never come here again.

The food is very good and stays consistent. The service leaves LOTS to desire. It's extremely slow. The food is not ready when promised. The one young girl who does the register is VERY unprofessional. She holds phone conversations on speakerphone using language not appropriate for a business setting. The men I've encountered are very polite, professional and courteous. I hope they make necessary improvements.

I ordered off of UberEats at the last possible second before closing. Based on other reviews it seems like the consistency of the restaurant probably does need to improve. But the current 3.7 average stars is so far from the flavor I experienced when ordering. The greens stew had delicious chunks of chicken and turkey neck which added a great deal of flavor. The goat jollof was out of this world good. I really liked that they make a kind of sticky rice for both the jollof and the white rice. The portions were very appropriate for the price I kept eating the same meal for 3 days without getting tired of it. Just the right amount of heat. I hope they improve on consistency and are around for a long time. I will be back
EVERYTIME I get cassava from them it taste sour or have a citrus flavor and I keep trying cause the food use to be good. IM DONE!!!

I took my teenage daughters today and was disgusted. The place was clean but empty. Not one customer. I ordered the fried rice with shrimp and there were only 3 baby shrimp and the rice was hard. I ordered the goat and couldn‚Äôt chew it at all. We didn‚Äôt order much and it cost $81. Upon check out I was asked how was the food and I replied that the goat was hard and he said I‚Äôm sorry.  No refund or anything.  I will be eating in the US from now on!

The food was very tasty full of flavor. Suya tasted like it was definitely re-heated‚Ä¶ The food was not spicy at all made to cater to all taste buds. I would say if you are in the area give it a try there is a bit of wait for the food to be ready so call in ahead.

I am visiting Philly and I was looking for a Nigerian restaurant. I ordered online via DoorDash and the food was good. The jollof rice tastes nice. The gizzard dodo is equally nice but they had less gizzard and more dodo. The ponmo is soft and spicy. ü•µ

I ordered assorted meat, but they gave me ponmo and beef. Ponmo and beef is not assorted. That was my only concern. Please don‚Äôt sell ponmo and beef as assorted üåö

I recently had the pleasure of dining at fork n fingers, and I was thoroughly impressed by the quality and flavor of the dishes. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with a warm and welcoming atmosphere, and our server was attentive and knowledgeable throughout the meal.
Food is tasty however the portion is way too small for the price. Either increase the portion or decrease the price. I paid $20 for something that wouldn‚Äôt even be enough for my 9 years old child

Got tired of mandingue bad customer service. I gave this pace a shot and I am not disappointed. Attieke was fresh and delicious. Meat flavorful. Customer service great. I ordered over the phone when I got there my food was ready. I just wish the meat had some onion sauce to it. Other than that love it . Thank you

If you‚Äôve never had African food before you‚Äôll probably enjoy this place. If you have, just skip it. It‚Äôs not bad but since it‚Äôs in an area with lots of African restaurants it doesn‚Äôt hold up to the competition in the area. Emma‚Äôs is a few blocks away and sooo much better. We tried the palava sauce and the pepper soup. It was not as spicy as most West African food tends to be but came with pepper sauce on the side to turn the heat up. The food had a good flavor but it wasn‚Äôt cooked long enough for the flavor to really get into the meat & bones. The cow foot was very tough and the fish in the soup was underdone. The fufu was not mixed well. It was edible but I was disappointed knowing I could have gone somewhere else nearby for much better food. Also, The bathroom smelled horribly and when I asked for soap I was informed they had none so I had to help myself to the dish detergent sitting just outside the bathroom.

The grilled fish and Achekeh was one of the best I have had in a long time. The fish was seasoned and well done and  the achekeh was not dry like other places lol. I will be coming back again for grilled fish
Authentic and delicious Liberian food. Big portions. Very good prices

(8/18/23) I unfortunately had to change my review. The young woman was going to send me off with old, nasty looking plantains until I mentioned who I was in relation to my husband (who is African and known to them), so she made new plantains and put them on top of the old ones. I was also upcharged (I questioned it and it was a sudden "change in price"). I believe in fairness across the board, and me not being born on the continent shouldn't mean I should get lower quality food.
.....
(3 years ago)
Their fish & plantains is pretty good. I was introduced to the meal by a friend and I have gotten hooked. The only thing is the price changes if you get the same thing one week versus another. It's a bit pricey, but there's probably a good reason for it. Overall, the meal is good with caramelized onions and mayo with vegetables.
Peanut butter soup and fufu was phenomenal. I have to get her to make me a whole personal pan. Loved it. Exquisite. Me and my roomie ate it together and she wanted more as did I.

I ordered
Potato greens
Cassava leaf
And now egusi . I love their food, it has so much flavor, smoked , peanut butter, and if you like hot it‚Äôs very spicy .
I love this place they are nice people and great food. I've been going here for years ! Everything's fresh! And tasty!

I was craving for fufu and searched on google map for an hour for authentic ones and finally chose this restaurant‚Äî I ordered from Uber eat, keep in mind that you will need to order at least 1-2 hours ahead during prime time because they may get extremely busy.

But their fufu is soooo goooddd üò≠ this is my second time eating fufu and I notice Susanna‚Äôs fufu is so much smoother and homogenized than the first fufu I had at another place. I love both texture and taste tho.

The cassava leaf taste very authentic! I personally like the cassava leaf than the pepper soup that comes with fufu better but it‚Äôs all personal preference. Next time I will order extra fufu!!

Wonderful food Beautiful people!
I wish Susana's Kitchen would please get some cow foot for me please ‚ù§Ô∏è
I had their beef kabobs,and  chicken they were very good
Overpriced basic food. Service too slow.
Good food , love the snapper fish
Yvonis jollof and suya is delicious. i love her refreshers as well. The owner is a very nice along with her employees.

The owner is such a beautiful blessing of a woman‚ô•Ô∏è
I love african cuisine!!! If i dont feel like driving i order from uber eats and i love this place..tonight ubereats mixed up the orders and ihad the wrong food..iwould have ate it but my son doesnt favor fu fu..the owner was very very nice when icalled and since she isnt far from me i decided to go in like she offered bcuz to get the order replaced through uber would have never happened..when iwent in she was so nice to me and my son..she even sent me home with an extra meal..such a beautiful blessing of a Queen‚ô•Ô∏è

We had African Small Pot deliver food to an event in Africatown, and they were extremely helpful. The staff was kind and the food was absolutely delicious. They made us vegetarian-friendly breakfast sandwiches, with eggs, peppers, onions, and garlic. Everyone who ate one thought they were incredible! They also gave us coffee and tea with the food. The delivery was on-time and the communication with the staff was reliable and consistent. Definitely consider ordering from them or giving them a visit!

My colleagues and I recently had the pleasure of visiting African Small Pot for the first time and everybody left with a smile. We had many different items from the menu (variety of fish, chicken, rice, greens, etc.) and everything was truly so delicious and flavorful! The entire staff including the chef and the owner were very welcoming and accommodating to us, as we were a large group. We are incredibly grateful! üåü See you again soon!

An absolute 10/10. The customer service was excellent, as well as the food. The owner was extremely attentive and made sure my friend and I were taken care of. I ordered some red snapper, with a side of rice, and some plantain. I will definitely be coming back.

This was my first time here, I came 20 minutes before closing. I ordered fried red snapper, and cassava leaf. The cassava leaf was good, the fried red snapper was nice and fresh the sauce was really good. I will be returning.

Food was great! Definitely recommend the grilled snapper and rice, absolutely delicious.
I typically order to go. I highly recommend that the owner of this restaurant redo the bathroom. Food is great but the atmosphere needs major improvement. I won't recommend dining in, just take out.

name: Mawa's African Cuisine (Authentic African & American Cuisine)

reviews.text: Authentic, delicious, plentiful, and memorable. This is an outstanding African restaurant with great flavor, value, and distinction. For those in Philly, it's worth the drive! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

A little annoyed bc I literally searched and searched for a new African place to try and thought this would be great but it wasn‚Äôt. Granted, I ordered through DoorDash but still, the quality of the food shouldn‚Äôt differ. I ordered potato greens and fufu bc I‚Äôve never tried potato greens before and got a container that said OKRA and very mushy, clumpy, watery fufu that was like mashed potatoes and impossible to eat my soup with‚Ä¶ Ive never had fufu like before so I‚Äôm very disappointed and don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be ordering from this place again.
The food is by far excellent. If you‚Äôre ever in the Delco area and hungry, Mawa‚Äôs is a must visit!!! The service and atmosphere is absolutely friendly.

üî• MUST-TRYüî•I just had another incredible meal from Jammie‚Äôs Creative Food and I had to leave a review this time! This family-owned local gem serves food that truly tastes like home.

I ordered lamb, plantains, and vegetable rice, and just WOW! The lamb was tender and flavorful, the plantains were perfectly caramelized, and the rice was light, fluffy, and packed with veggies.

You can tell every bite is made with love, passion, and authenticity. Whether you order online or visit in person, you won‚Äôt be disappointed. Support this amazing spot‚Äî10/10 recommend!

Very good. Fufu was fresh and soft. Didn‚Äôt pair well with the potato greens but I just wanted to try something new. The potato greens were very good. I enjoyed this meal for 3days straight. Very full filling and delicious food. I will be back to try there other dishes
It was definitely worth the one hour drive. I got jollof rice with lamb and it was so good!!! I recommend this place, portions are amazing.
This food was amazing. Very flavorful. I will be going again
The food is okay but overpriced and keeps changing prices...

I've been seeing this on tiktok for the past 2 weeks and decided lastnight to try.
When I came in I had to greet the lady working.  Didn't like that, I'm coming in to spend my money. Welcome would've been nice! She didn't even ask could she take my order.  My husband and I seen a kiosk and placed our order.  The food was a 6/10.
Jollof rice was flavorless, steak was chewy and had fat/Gristle on each piece.
The salad that came with it was good along with the plantains. The potato greens were watery and ok.  Overall I love supporting my people businesses but I probably won't be back.  Respectfully

Came here with friend. Treated them to west African food for their birthday. We arrived around 730 which was right on time. After we ordered our food on the kiosk and set down a big crowd came in. So many people came to order food before the night was out. The food was delicious. The white suya sauce was good with hot drumsticks. I was super impressed with the food. Even my friend.  I also had cornbread with my meal and the corn bread was delicious too.
Both of our food together was about 40 to 45 dollars. Very reasonable.
When you dine in. Your food does come on a sturdy paper plate.  Felt authentic and home vibes.

You can see the food being prepared which I love so much.

Unsure if they have a restroom for the public.

I ordered online, and my food arrived fresh and hot, which I really appreciated.

I tried the Beef Suya (spicy) platter with plantain, cabbage, onion, and jollof rice. The jollof rice was definitely the best part it was flavorful and perfectly cooked. The beef Suya was tender with a nice texture and good spice, though I found it a bit too salty. I have a high spice tolerance, but even for me the heat built up and made it tough to finish, so I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to anyone sensitive to spice.

Portion-wise, I wish there had been more plantain and onion, as the serving felt small compared to the generous amount of rice.

I also ordered a chicken Suya leg on the side, and in my opinion, the chicken Suya was much better than the beef.

This African spot is amazing! Definitely try the Suya bowl because it‚Äôs a great deal and packed with flavor. Some of the dishes were spicy even at the lowest spice level, so watch out if you‚Äôre not big on heat. You HAVE to get the cornbread as a side. It‚Äôs seriously so good. Loved everything about this place and will definitely be back. Seems like it‚Äôs easier to dine in and let the food come out when it ready instead of ordering online.

Located in northern liberties, so parking can be a challenge. I wanted to like this food. The price isn‚Äôt awful, but it‚Äôs not the great either. I paid about $15 for the steak bowl with jollof and plantain, and then another $4 for a meat pie. Everything was lackluster. The meat pie ingredients tasted muddled, I did enjoy the crust tho. The jollof rice flavor was mild, I wish it stood out more‚Ä¶ as in more tomato taste, more richness‚Ä¶ anything to resemble Nigerian jollof. The steak suya was fine‚Ä¶ it was a bit tough, and majority of the flavor came from the sprinkled suya spice over top. The plantain was light skin and hard and they weren‚Äôt very sweet. I‚Äôve been meaning to try the restaurant and I finally did. I‚Äôm not impressed.

I love it here! Someone told me about Emma‚Äôs which is close by, I went and they were so rude, the place stunk and everything so I took my business elsewhere where, good this place which was near by AND IVE BEEN EATING HERE EVERY SINCE!!! FROM THE TIME I CAME IN THEY WERE SO WELCOMING, PATIENT, ANSWERED QUESTIONS FOR ME AND MY FAMILY, GAVE RECOMMENDATIONS, AND TOLD ME CALL AHEAD OF TIME IF I HAD ANY SPECIAL REQUEST!!!! PLEASE GO NOW!! THE DRY RICE AND SNAPPER IS MY FAVORITE!! THE FUFU & SOUP IS MY FAVORITE!!!!!
Best dry rice and fish in the city. The grill food is amazing. The family is always courteous and nice to everyone.
She is the Best in SouthWest! Top Tier African Cuisineüòã
Kabobs always a hit I go twice a  week in the summer
You‚Äôre phone number is not going through

JD African Restaurant has great food and the food is prepared with care. I went into the restaurant with my mom buying food to ship to Florida. That's how good JD's food is. Apparently, Florida doesn't have African Food but we specifically go to JD then anywhere else in the area. Keep up the good work üëç

The food is tasty but the platter is half empty. Why are you not putting the right amount of food in the bowl? I got cassava leaf two times in one week. The first time I gave a pass because it was later in the day but the second time I came as soon as they open and same thing. A small serving. The bowl not even filled to the top. Barely half way. Mainly unknown pieces of meat. Really no cassava. Very disappointing because the flavor is good. Tsk. Side note the guy that takes my order isn‚Äôt very welcoming at all.

I had the potato greens with white rice! It‚Äôs really good but they barely give you enough food in the bowl! It‚Äôs not ever filled to the top! That super cheap üí© to do! ü§¶üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è African food isn‚Äôt cheap either! Give people their moneys worth!

I absolutely love the greens and rice that this restaurant serves it is very well seasoned with a hint of spiciness. It comes with a side of sweet cornbread.

The portion size is also good, but I‚Äôve eaten half of what you see in the picture but you get more than enough rice.

There are lots of fresh juices and carbonated drinks. They only take CASH!

JD!!!! I always get the usual FRIED Tilapia and white RICE fish was sooo fresh!! He always add something on the rice for me! Very welcoming there Always Clean !! No other African spot will ever get my money THE BEST!!

During my recent visit to Aunty K's West African Restaurant, I had a great experience. The restaurant was clean and well-maintained, with a few tables and chairs for customers to dine in. The daily menu and prices were displayed on chalkboards behind the counter, making it easy to decide what to order.

The staff was very friendly and welcoming. Sidique came out from behind the counter to greet me, which made me feel welcomed.

Although my favorite cassava leaf soup was unavailable on this visit, Sidique assured me it would be back on the menu soon. As an alternative, I decided to try the Peanut Butter Soup.

The Peanut Butter Soup was delicious. Its savory taste balanced the slight sweetness of the peanut butter. The soup was rich and hearty, with stew chicken and beef. It was served with a generous portion of white rice. They also provided a small container of hot pepper sauce on the side, allowing me to customize the heat level.

Overall, Aunty K's West African Restaurant is a clean and friendly establishment with tasty food. I look forward to returning soon.

Aunty K‚Äôs fried rice and mackerel were really good! You can taste the pepper and it was a lot of food. To my pleasant surprise it came with fried sweet plantains and a very spicy pepper sauce (use with caution). The lady at the counter was polite and i waited and watched their tv as they prepared my food.

Had a good time eating at this African restaurant for the first time, Food was good and the ambiance was excellent. Customer service by the owner was great. We had dry rice and beef. I will recommend anyone who wants to try a taste.
Picked up to go. Sooo good . First time trying acheke + for the price lasted me at least 2 meals
Food was delicious my first time I taste this on Tuesday night I‚Äôll definitely be back I wasn‚Äôt disappointed at all thank u

I was passing by this place on my not usual way home from work when I decided to stop and try Nigerian food for the first time. And I‚Äôm glad I did!

First the food. Delicious!  I have a feeling most people come in already knowing what they want or at least speak Yoruba. The menu does not have any descriptions, but there are a few pictures on the wall to help.  Since this was my first time having Nigerian food, I asked them to choose for me, only telling them ‚Äúno fish or rice‚Äù and that ‚ÄúI like meat and vegetables‚Äù.  Was rewarded with a healthy portion of efo riru (Nigerian spinach stew) with added meat (cubes of stewed beef) and a softball sized portion of hot fufu. Cost $17 and I was stuffed.

Although they gave me utensils, I ate it traditionally with my hands scooping the stew together with the fufu. The stew was really good! Very flavorful and not overly spicy. There was plenty of vegetables and was cooked just right. If I had to offer a suggestion - the added meat could have been smaller and in more even pieces. But it‚Äôs very small complaint.

Service: was good! My
Meal was ready quickly and was packed up securely with napkins and utensils.

Atmosphere : There are three or so booths to eat at, with lots of napkins and salt shakers, but it‚Äôs really a take it to go place - a ‚Äúhole in the wall‚Äù neighborhood place where your money is going to the food, not the decor. I ate in because I live more than 40 minutes away and was starving.

There is a handwashing station so you can wash your hands before and after eating. Also got to watch some news on the large screen tv.

Value : $17 dollars and I was happily stuffed. I could have made into two meals but was very hungry.  I ordered a Second portion to take home. 100% Would go back!
Omg worse food ever eugsi was horrible out one spoon in my mouth and wanted to throw up..$17 down the drain and it stinks, get at your own risk

Customer service is completely awful. I asked the lady at the front about a dish and she yelled at me saying, if you don‚Äôt know it don‚Äôt try it. If this restaurant wants to survive, please remove her from the front, she has horrible customer service.  She also said ‚Äúwhat type of questions is that‚Äù I‚Äôm confused, if you‚Äôre running a food business aren‚Äôt you supposed to have capacity to answer questions about your menu? To make matters worse, it was only 1 other person in the restaurant so it‚Äôs not like she didn‚Äôt have time. I left without even ordering because I don‚Äôt trust people like that making food I can‚Äôt see them making. People make sure you know exactly what you want
Food portions are huge! I was quite surprised. The jollof rice and chicken was okay. It could have been a little more flavorful. The soup was freaking delicious! Must get with fish.

Authentic & Fresh Nigerian food. Most orders are made from scratch so I recommend calling ahead to place an order to allow time for preparation. And especially for Moi-Moi, call early before they are sold out for the day. They never disappoint when I'm craving Nigerian food. üòã

I had a great time at AF and I felt welcomed.
I was more than satisfied with the food and ambiance. The portions and flavors were on point! Especially the Plaintain Fritters!!! I will definitely be a regular. Miami Needed this!
Amazing atmosphere awesome food. Food is very delicious, tasty and well seasoned will highly and definitely recommend.
Went there with a group of friend the vibes was great, food was excellent and the hookah smooth. Deff our new spot
Every time I come to Miami I have to stop by Afro Fusion Miami, they make the best food and have the best service. Thank you for the good eats!
This is the chef come to my restaurant and enjoy African Jamaican flavors. Thanks to all and see you soon.

Quick friendly service and food was delicious. Please PLEASE try the potato greens..lawd!! They are sooo good. I've gotten snapper fillet both times I've eaten here.. great seasoning and flavor. Be careful with the pepper sauce if you are not experienced with spicy foods!

Couldn‚Äôt even finish the food it was soo nasty!!
Lol jk, this was amazing food. I just moved to MIA from out of town and have been craving Liberian food for sooo long. I was so happy to find this restaurant and try their potato greens. Omg it‚Äôs to die for, and the pepper sauce was excellent. Thank you Fannoh Flavor üíö I can‚Äôt wait to order more food from y‚Äôall

There is no denying that Fannoh is one of the best chefs in South Florida. His portion sizes are HUGE, the food is authentic, and his personality is amazing. Highly recommend the attieke and fish or pepper chicken and the palava sauce with fufu.

My daughter‚Äôs graduation party is coming up and she wanted Liberian food. Reached out to Fannoh Flavor and even though he had to leave town he made sure to get our order made so we would have it for her party that is coming up. Haven‚Äôt tasted Liberian food in years. I appreciate it and so does my belly!

I‚Äôve been struggling to find good authentic African food in the area for a while. So happy I came across Fannoh Food Truck! I ordered their Fufu and Chicken Pepper Soup and it was delicious! Super spicy and the chicken was so flavorful and tender! Everything was so fresh! Will definitely be going back to try more menu items asap! 10/10

My friends and I went after work and this place is a WHOLE Vibe!! Nice atmosphere and beautifully decorated. The cocktails are a little pricey but very good. I had the Jua Smoke with Mezcal - perfection! ü§åüèæ My second cocktail was the Hibiscus Old Fashion. It was good as well but could not compete with that Jua Smoke! Three of my friends had the Guava Glow and they all enjoyed them. For food, I ordered the chicken suya and it was good, very flavorful and moist. The beignets were just ok. A friend got the plantains and they were very good, nicely caramelized. Service was great - the waitress was very good and attentive so I didn't mind paying the 20% gratuity that is automatically added to your bill. I was a little disappointed they they don't have an actual Happy Hour, being in downtown Denver, but I enjoyed it and will definitely return.

Absolutely loved our visit to Trybal! The vibes were amazing- the perfect setting for a girls' night out. The music, lighting, and overall atmosphere created such a fun and laid-back experience. The small bites were honestly some of the best l've had at a bar. We tried almost every cocktail on the menu. My personal favorites were the Guava Glow, Zamanj Espresso Martini, and Pineapple Juju- Each one perfectly crafted and so delicious. Customer service is a 10/10 from the chef to all of the front of house staff. A special shoutout to Jacob, our bartender, who was super friendly and made some great recommendations.
