Definitely will be going back.

A unique spot in demver, feels high end like a fine lounge scene.  Lighting and art create a proper ambience for relaxed and casual energy with an elevated and classy feel.  The musc set the tone perfectly, this place is a proper vibe.
Jacob and Kedar took care of me at the bar, I really enjoyed the Ayo Twist w gin, the mezcal version was nice as well.  Kedar even  made me an off menu drink which was perfect.  Dont skip the Amarula martini either.
The beef suya was proper snd so was the jollof.  Next time ill be sure to try chicken suya and some puffs.
I will definitely return to this spot along the 16th st downtown corridor with friends, looking forward to another great experience at trybal.

I had a beautiful experience at Trybal! It was a great atmosphere, amazing staff, and a unique experience I have never seen before. It‚Äôs quickly become one of my new favorite places in Denver!
I fell in love with their version of the Espresso Martini, definitely a must try. And the food on the Motherland plate was truly delicious. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more!

Such a great lounge from the food to the drinks to the ambiance! Perfect for a girls night or date night. The food was authentic West African and the drinks were AMAZING!! They also had many great mocktail options. We will definitely be back again!

Very Nice service. And, very good food. As a Senegalese Liberian, I wasnt expecting less from my Birthland Senegal that has some of the best food in West Africa. especially the best Jollof rice aka Thieboudienne from Senegal the originators of the dish Jollof rice. Thank you Ms Meimouna. I really had a good time coming in today with my Friend. The thieboudienne, bisaap and thiakri were great. So yummy.

I will start off by saying I love African food, and was excited to see that this opened up just near me.

I walk inside(I am the only one inside), and pitch black, just one or two lights on. A guy sitting on the floor behind the bar, pops up, and asks what am I doing? I ask him for a table for 1, and he is confused, and we go back and forth. He says pick a table, I sit down, and then he says come and get your menu, so I stand up and grab the menu from his hand, and he sits back down on the floor.

I sit there for about five minutes and no one comes to me to take my order. While sitting there, there is a baby just wearing a diaper, running in and outside of the kitchen, obviously a workers kid. Not sure how this place passed health inspection, you can tell from one good look, that its going to be a rough experience. Don't use your money here.
My experience is always great here, I have eaten here more than two hands full of times..very flavorful meals, very fresh, and  my close friends also enjoy Thiebodienne as well.
I think they just opened and have really yummy take out! The chicken and rice and okra were all delicious and a lot of food for a good price!
I just tried this place and it was really good! Friendly service and the fish dish I had was very tasty.

name: Konjo Ethiopian Food
vicinity: INSIDE of The Edgewater Public Market, 5505 W 20th Ave Suite #106, Edgewater

reviews.text:
This was my first time trying Ethiopian food, so I decided to visit Konjo in the Edgewater food court. The setup is very straightforward ‚Äî you order through a kiosk/tablet, enter your phone number, and they text you when your order is ready. Easy and convenient.

I tried the Chicken Tibs Plate with Misir Wot and injera. The chicken was on the spicier side, almost like a cousin of Indian-style chicken curry, which I enjoyed. The injera flatbread was soft and filling, with the bubble texture showing it had been fermented. It did have a noticeable sour taste ‚Äî I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs how it‚Äôs supposed to be, but it was interesting to try.

I also ordered a sambusa for $3. It was a deep-fried pastry with a lentil/pulse filling, but the shell was a bit oily and on the harder side, so not something I‚Äôd go back for.

Just a heads-up that there‚Äôs a credit card surcharge and a public improvement fee added to the bill.

We ordered a plate with lamb and beef, and it was so spicy it was barely edible. We thought that the flavors were a bit odd and unfortunately both my husband and I got a food poisoning. We were excited to try Ethiopian food but that was a terrible introduction to the cuisine.

Eat here, plain and simple. If you get the chance get one of everything.

I don't know anything about authenticity, but I've eaten my way around an injera or two and I LOVE the bread here! Bouncy and tender texture and definitely sour!

All of the vegetable dishes are fantastic. Lentils have always been cooked well and the greens are tender and not mushy. My favorite is the cabbage, I could eat a bucket.
Food absolutely taste authentic. And its got some spice to it. I got the lamb! The dish definitely tasted rich to me.

This is my favorite place to eat within Edgewater Public Market. It‚Äôs a great place to eat for vegan/vegetarians. I always get all 4 veggies and the rolls. Keep in mind the lentils are spicy but good! My husband and I get the 1 plate to share and its plenty

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è 5 stars for 5Star Eritrean Cafe!

I came in for a platter and a cappuccino and left with a full belly, a happy heart, and leftovers to enjoy the next day. First impression of the food? Wow. This was edible art. Perfectly plated with vibrant colors and textures, and injera that looked and tasted legit from the very first bite. Every component on the platter had its own flavor story, and together they created a masterpiece. The server even brought out some berbere spice to sprinkle on top, which was the perfect touch. The vibe of the cafe was modern and relaxed, with upbeat music playing and a chill, cozy feel. I was the only customer for most of the meal, which made the experience feel extra peaceful and personal. And the cappuccino? So. Good. Rich, smooth, and foamed to perfection. I actually caught myself wondering, ‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt I start every day like this?‚Äù If you're looking for flavorful food, legit coffee, and an atmosphere that hits all the right notes, 5Star Eritrean Cafe is the move. Can‚Äôt wait to go back and try more.

This is an adorable little corner restaurant. The owners are on site and really take pride in their work. It seems to be extremely authentic food, and many of the patrons were speaking in their native language with the staff. I really loved the decor. The food was delicious! We got like a sampler platter and some lamb. Each dish was perfectly prepared and seasoned. It seemed like a lot of Care and attention went into each dish and it would've taken me hours and days to make something like this, so it seems like a great deal!
We also got a fruit smoothie. I think it was hard to communicate with the waiter on this. I asked him if it was real fruit or if it had added sugar. He said yes to real fruit and no to added sugar, but it was pretty obviously a premixed product that likely had corn syrup. I think it was just that he didn't understand English well enough to figure out what I was asking.

Nice breakfast/lunch spot. The egg sandwich was excellent, but it would have been nice to have a smaller. This portion was huge. The peppers on it were very hot. They also have some interesting Eritrean options.

Service was fast and friendly but it took a while for the food to come out. The space is nicely decorated. A video of birds chirping in a cherry garden provided a pleasant atmosphere.

There is plenty of parking in the morning,

I visited 5 Star Caf√© Eritrean & Ethiopian Restaurant and bought the best sandwich I‚Äôve ever had. The bread was delicious, and every ingredient inside was perfectly balanced and flavorful.

But what truly made it unforgettable was the young lady with curly hair and big, beautiful eyes. I felt like she put her heart into making it, and that‚Äôs why it tasted so amazing.

If you happen to read this, please find me on Instagram @Constantinpax ‚Äî I‚Äôd love the chance to meet you!

It‚Äôs very fun to have Ethiopian food. The service was very kind and thoughtful. The portion sizes were pretty big. There‚Äôs a decent amount of variety on the menu to choose from and they have a full bar.

The restaurant was peaceful and quiet. The server was attentive and accommodating. The food was AMAZING! I do not eat spicy food but I couldn‚Äôt stop eating the lamb dish I had. I even ordered a plate TO GO

The FOOD was amazing! The staff was friendly and happy to explain the dishes. I personally loved the way she poured the food onto the platter. Made it extra special. I loved the Beef tips so much flavor and so juicy! I can‚Äôt wait to come back! Keep up the good work Lucy Ethiopian Restaurant!!!
Delicious food! We tried different dishes, and all of them were good. The kids enjoyed it very much, and so did we. Friendly service.

Terrible Experience  Would Never Recommend This was honestly one of the worst dining experiences I‚Äôve ever had. From the moment we walked in, the hostess/waitress was extremely rude and unwelcoming. We specifically asked not to be served lamb, yet she brought us lamb anyway. When we politely pointed it out, she responded with a bad attitude instead of apologizing or fixing the mistake.
What made it even worse was that the owner was present the entire time and never once came over to check on us or ask how our food or service was. But as we were leaving, she had the nerve to confront one of our guests instead of addressing the real issue her staff‚Äôs behavior and the overall poor service.
This place should not even be open. It was a huge disappointment from start to finish. I would never go back or recommend it to anyone.

after extensive research, I decided to take my family to Lucy for our first Ethiopian cuisine experience in Denver - and it did not disappoint. a solid 5 stars for flavor alone - the food is well worth the wait (20-30 min).

the meal is an experience of flavor and texture, ending in complete satiety and meant to be shared and eaten with the hands. not to mention an amazing value - you could feed a family of 3-4 for around $35.

we started with 2 veggie sambusas - a fried pocket pastry with a flaky crust and a filling of spiced peas. it was. delicious. the crust was perfectly flaky and they came out super fresh. the inside was spiced right and had a nice contrast to the crust.

the main feature was the veggie combo platter - it comes with most of their signature dishes and injera bread. the injera had a sour taste like sourdough bread. it was soft, spongy, and dreamy - they even offered us more when we finished ours. everything was DELICIOUS. I cannot say enough good.

we left incredibly satisfied. don‚Äôt come here in a rush. sit, enjoy the food, ideally with others.

‚ÄúFlavorful‚Äù describes it. This is a very solid example of Ethiopian food (at least as served in the US ‚Äî haven‚Äôt been to Ethiopia itself so no point of comparison). If you‚Äôve been to Ethiopian before you will not be surprised by anything.  The menus all seem to be pretty much the same and this is no exception.  But that‚Äôs not a reason not to go.  It‚Äôs damn delicious.  And, for first timers like my kids, the joy of eating with your hands / injera is something not to be missed.

Delicious Ethiopian food, one of our favorite hidden gems in Denver. Super flavorful, hearty portion sizes, great service, overall an amazing experience. Would definitely recommend checking this restaurant out! The spicy beef stew was a particular favorite.

Holy Moly! This place is incredible and so authentic. I grew up in DC which is known as the epicenter of Ethiopian food. This place is just as good as any of the places in DC and it turns out because they used to own one that my family used to frequent. Run to this place if you want delicious food.

Don‚Äôt worry about Colfax construction, there was enough parking on the side streets that it was a quick walk. Totally worth every step my wife and I took.

Amazing experience at this Ethiopian restaurant! As a vegetarian, I loved the variety of flavorful veg dishes, especially the lentils and greens. The injera was fresh and perfectly tangy. The staff was friendly and helpful, making the whole experience even better. Highly recommend for delicious and authentic Ethiopian food!

This family run business deserves more than five stars! It's a shame I don't dine here as often as I should, but it truly is a hidden gem of authentic Ethiopian food.

The staff is always accommodating, kind, and thoughtful. When I dined here regularly, the owner of the establishment would remember me!

If you're looking for a unique culinary experience, I would highly suggest this place. The meats and lentils never disappoint, and their sour bread is to die for. Paired with one of their Ethiopean beers, I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. Although suitable for a small group, I think this place is best with a large group as food is often shared and you'll be able to try more things on the menu.
first time having Ethiopian food and it was so so good! My friends and I split the 7 veggie sampler, some sambusas, and the plantains. Excellent service and excellent food.

Positively delightful! It was my first time trying Ethiopian cuisine and our server was friendly and patient with us. Highly recommend the meat and vegetable sampler. It could easily feed 3-4 people. We had the plantains for an appetizer, best plantains I‚Äôve ever had! Also tried the honey wine - I would recommend trying it at least once, comes in a cool glass. We had both the gluten & gluten free injera (bread like food served with the meal) - both were delicious.
Friendly staff, clean restaurant, reasonably priced, very positive experience.

First time having Ethiopian and it was amazing! I could probably eat 20 of their sambusas and the lamb in my dish was so tender. My husband is a spice fiend and he said his dish was the perfect balance of spiciness and flavor. My kids were unimpressed with the offerings but that's on us to broaden their culinary horizons better. Anyway. Staff was very kind to us, I was out of my element so their hospitality was much appreciated. Food was filling and so tasty and I definitely see us returning in the future. Thanks!!

The food was decent, but the overall experience was disappointing. The bathroom was in poor shape ‚Äî no hand soap or paper towels and clearly way overdue for cleaning. Service was very slow even though we were the only table after another group left, and we had to ask several times for basics like water refills and another round of drinks. (I know it's typically a relaxed pace at Ethiopian restaurants, but this was extra slow.) They were also out of several menu items, and despite displaying multiple beers, only one option was available. Lastly, their payment system is sketchy  ‚Äî to pay with a credit card the server had to call someone (perhaps the owner) so we could pay via a link to Square. Wish we‚Äôd been able to go to Lucy‚Äôs, but they‚Äôre closed on Mondays.

Went there a week ago. The place was empty and the lights were off. The waiter/chef stated that they were open. Went with a party of four. The experience was like the twilight zone. No appetizers were available. No soap in the bathroom. The food was okay, however we each received only one injera and then they ran out. The chef stated that they would be receiving more in 15 minutes. We didn't wait and finished our meals. Would never go back.

The fried okra soup was pretty good. Pretty spicy. If you haven't had African food it's best to look it because they don't have a menu to tell you what's in the dishes. The girl behind the counter wasn't very helpful. Overall the food was good, just a bit on the expensive side.
Tasty food. The best Jollof rice I've ever had so far. The food was worth the wait.
For the new management that took over, the dry rice  and fish is good. I have tried other dishes (cassava leaves and Potatoe greens) previously and they were ok.

I loved the decor! The food is delightful! The fufu is soft and sticky and soaks up and gravy and tames a bit of the kick and the heat was perfect where it's not over powering. I loved the digital menu board and that it is a simple menu. It's an order at the counter type restaurant. The service was wonderful in my experience. Of course it's a bit hidden in a very mini strip mall off of 19th/Glendale. As they say "hole in the wall restaurants tend to have the best food".

This was a nice find on a Saturday. The place is quaint, with about seven tables. The food was amazing. I tried the jollof rice and fried red snapper. That meal did not disappoint. I was so happy that I stopped in. One would argue that the process are steeple. I paid $35 during lunch hours for an authentic west African meal. I have no regrets and will return to try other dishes.

Accessible entrance.

Let me start by saying the people who work here are very nice but, yes the service is a bit slow. We ordered a the Taste of Ethiopia and I personally enjoyed the vegan dishes more than the meat dishes. My personal fav was the Shiro Wot. This dish is very large and can definitely be split amongst 4 people. In addition to food we also ordered a fresh juice and a spiced hot tea which were both very good. If you enjoy tea please try their spiced tea. Other than service being a bit slow the atmosphere was great and very welcoming.

I almost forgot to add that we also had a Tiramisu for dessert. The slice was pretty big and can be shared.

Tuesday night visit, first visit. We spent nearly two hours at the restaurant. Our order consisted of an appetizer and two entrees. The service was ok. The server was nice, things just took awhile to come out. The ambience was low lighting. We had a mix of meat and vegan items with sega wot key and meser wot being our favorites. The awaze wings were well seasoned.

Ten stars üåü                                                               beautiful environment, atmosphere and interior design. I can't call it decor because that word does not do justice to the lovely walls that appear to be beautiful wood carvings, nor does the term decor have the esteem to refer to the cultural artifacts thoughtfully placed about - the natural enhancement of lighting , and the comfortable seating areas with clean adorable apolstrty. The food was tasty and served after preparation in a timely manner that compliments the flow of conversation. I think my favorite was the Doro Wat, along with the beets, and the chickpeas, however the cheese was light and creamy and the enjira bread was mellow, tangy, soft to the touch and added the proper balance to the spices and flavors . The absolute highlight and great surprise was the staff! These were the kindest, with pleasant voices, understanding spirits and just incredible Gentleman who took out order and served us. It was as soothing as a spa date to be under their care . One last note my friends, you MUST  treat yourself to the fruit drink...where do I start...it seems to be a fresh puree of sweet tropical fruits layered in glass with various delicies. Each layer of fruit bounces with flavor as you sink your straw in at different levels to find distinct flavors of watermelon , mango etc each like memories of childhood when we played all day outdoors and  fruit was sweet & real. So much better than candy but did remind me a bit of mambas but healthy. The juice in itself could be a meal And worthy of a visit. Please do go, and thx again to the Staff for making this a peaceful wonderful meal. We arrived mid afternoon and left full and happy. Enjoy!

I have tried injera from almost every Habesha restaurant, but nothing compares to the injera from Authentic EthioAfrican Kitchen & Bar. It's so soft and pliable that you can stretch it with two hands like taffy, and it absolutely does not crumble or break. What's truly amazing is that this level of quality is rare even back in Ethiopia, unless it's baked for a special occasion. If you want to taste what real, authentic Ethiopian injera is like, this is the place to go. The quality is simply exceptional!

This place is great, the service is very slow, so don't come in a rush. The food is amazing. Also, pro tip on Sambusas, it is a single Sambusa, no like a plate of them. Also mix their specialty drink before drinking it, its not very sweet until you mix it.

The wings are awesome and the Gluten Free carrot cake is soooo moist and the frosting is perfect. I ate it too fast to take a pic üòÖ.

This is not a restaurant but the service and atmosphere are remarkable. I enjoyed every moment. Don Tomas is full of wisdom. He is direct and will not steer you in the wrong direction. I left feeling fulfilled and accomplished. Will definitely be back. Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è
Definitely was on point both times I went. Had to send my friends. And affordable!!

I'm a huge fan of Ethiopian food and have tried it everywhere I've lived in the US and abroad, when it's been available.  This place is so far my favorite in the Phoenix area!  We tried the vegetarian/vegan combo and foul, as well as the lentil sambusas.  Everything was incredible, service was very friendly and welcoming, and we loved the decoration and music.

Whether you love Ethiopian food and are craving shiro wot and zilzil tibs, or this is your first time, you owe it to yourself to try Kare!

The lady who served is was such an amazing soul. From preparing the food for us to telling us what everything was! She was so sweet and made sure we loved everything! And told us about the buffet they do as well! Definitely will be back!

Kare has the best Ethiopian food in the valley hands down. I love how chill the atmosphere inside with Ethiopian customers chatting and watching Ethiopian music videos. First I ordered meat sambusas. They are super crispy and the filling is delicious. The sauce is very spicy but delicious. We got the meat & vegetable combo and it was delicious. I love meat but the veggies were super good. Finally I got the traditional Ethiopian coffee and that was so earthy and delicious. It comes with a burning frankincense you can smell while drinking the coffee. We hung out there for a while after dinner and had a few glasses of Ethiopian wine. They also sell spices and coffee products I feel like I must return and buy some Berbere spices.

My friends and I had such a wonderful time here tonight.  The atmosphere was relaxed, the service was great, and the food was delicious. We all enjoyed the coffee, meat and veggie combo and red wine tremendously. Absolutely recommend this establishment.

Kare is the real deal. The taste of love is in every morsel that exits the kitchen. My wife and I have been here numerous times now and it has always been consistently fantastic. The Ethiopian coffee set definitely creates an experience and enhances things beautifully before the main course is served. Both meat and veggie options are absolutely phenomenal. We have never left feeling anything other than completely stuffed and immensely satisfied. Enjoy!

name: Abyssinia Restaurant and Cafe Ethiopian Cuisine

reviews.text: Azi was super friendly the owner! Food was fresh and delicious üòã honey wine was good as well, most of all I loved her coffee ‚òïÔ∏è she offered it for free which i thought was very sweet of her, Thank you Azi for being so friendly and nice to our family and kids. God bless you üôè‚ù§Ô∏è

To start - I‚Äôm super picky about where I go out to eat. I literally spend hours figuring it out because there‚Äôs nothing I dislike more than spending money on food that‚Äôs not good. With that being said, this place‚Ä¶

Love it! I went here for the first time and the food was really good.

Firstly, the honey wine is really good. The flavors of the food are so well combined that it‚Äôs a perfect balance between the spices. The spices don‚Äôt distract from the food itself. I find that a lot of places use spices to cover up the poor quality of what they‚Äôre feeding you - this was not the case at this restaurant.

The injera bread was great. Perfect compliment to the main course. The lentil samosa were phenomenal. Perfect bit of spice.

One thing that I was pleasantly surprised with is that the meat is not just precooked and then reheated. I can always tell when food is reheated (I hate the taste of it) and this was not. So the fact that it was cooked to order was made it even better.

The owners definitely care about the food they are serving you and you can tell when you eat it.

If you‚Äôre up in the air about finding somewhere to eat and you read this review‚Ä¶

EAT HERE. trust me‚Ä¶.
The food was great. Traditionally prepared and served. The waitstaff were friendly and accommodating. I'll be back!

The food was amazing! And honestly very well priced we ordered the veggie signature dish, 2 meat dishes and sambusas and it was very affordable. Everything was SOO flavorful!
The service was great! Our waitress was very kind and super helpful !
The restaurant itself was very cozy, authentic decor, and I enjoyed being able to have our own private area to enjoy our food.

Absolutely amazing. The owner is a wonderful woman who made me feel right at home and recommended different dishes. The birz is sweet and delicious, and the lamb was perfectly cooked, served piping hot and quite literally the best butter-braised lamb I've ever had. The injera was fluffy and just the right sourness and came with a bright fresh green salad. Highly, highly recommend coming here.

The food at Gojo Ethiopian was very good ‚Äì we tried the Gojo Combo, Meat Combo, Meat & Veggie Combo, and also ordered Doro Wot. Everything tasted authentic and flavorful.

However, the service needs improvement. There was only one server for the whole restaurant, and we had to ask for basic things like water glasses. The portion sizes also felt too small for the price. For example, the Doro Wot was $14 but came with only one piece of chicken and one egg, which didn‚Äôt feel worth it.

Overall, delicious food but service and portion sizes could be much better.

A restaurant with a truly interesting atmosphere, uniquely designed to offer an authentic Ethiopian experience. The food, prepared by an Ethiopian lady chef, had a genuine homemade taste rich in tradition and flavor. A wonderful place to visit and enjoy a memorable meal.

This place deserves more love! Stopped by for lunch on a Friday. The mixed veggie & meat platter was delicious and affordable - I stuffed myself and ate the whole thing by myself, but it was enough food for two people to split. The injeera bread in particular was perfect. The decor is really cool and our server was friendly.

Owner is super friendly! Felt welcomed Great customer service. First time here and we enjoyed our dinner, if you've never tried ethiopian food definitely come here the food tasted very authentic and you might like it!! We tried their honey wine it was super good üëå
Injera bread was delicious!
Owner said his wife did all the cooking and she did really good! ‚ò∫Ô∏èüëç
My toddler is 2 years old and he loved the injera bread!! Toddler approved üëåüòÅ

I ordered to go, and really enjoyed the meal
I look forward to going back to explore more of their menu

I‚Äôve been eating at First Cup Ethiopian Restaurant on and off for over five years, and every single time it‚Äôs been an incredible experience. The food is always of excellent quality‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and consistently prepared with care. That consistency is rare to find, and it‚Äôs one of the main reasons I keep coming back.
The service is outstanding. The team here greets me warmly every visit, and what touches me the most is the love and compassion they extend‚Äîwelcoming me barefoot without judgment. That level of respect and kindness goes far beyond food; it‚Äôs a reflection of their beautiful spirit.
If you‚Äôre looking for a restaurant where the food is always top-notch, the service is heartfelt, and the atmosphere feels like home, this is the place.
Love and ((HUGS)),
Laura Foster
Founder, Souls Healing Humanity

Second time here, and I'll definitely be back. Excellent food and service. As I am not Ethiopian, I don't know much about the food or what is customary, but the Lady here was very nice and answered all the questions I had. I had a vegetarian plate, and I am not leaving hungry. Thank you First Cup.

A True Taste of Ethiopia in Arizona!

From the moment I stepped inside, I was greeted with the warm, welcoming hospitality that Ethiopian culture is known for. The restaurant‚Äôs atmosphere is cozy yet vibrant, with traditional music and beautiful d√©cor that instantly transports you to Addis Ababa.

The food was absolutely outstanding. The injera was soft, fresh, and perfectly tangy, and the variety of wot dishes was a flavorful journey‚Äîeach stew rich in spices and depth. The doro wot was tender and savory, with just the right amount of heat, and the misir wot had that comforting, earthy taste that makes you want to keep eating long after you‚Äôre full. Vegetarians and meat lovers alike will find something to love here.

What truly sets this place apart is the care and authenticity in every bite. You can tell the recipes are made with love and passed down through generations. The coffee ceremony was a beautiful experience‚Äînot just a drink, but a cultural ritual, filling the air with the rich aroma of freshly roasted beans.

Whether you‚Äôre new to Ethiopian cuisine or a lifelong fan, this restaurant is a must-visit. It‚Äôs more than just a meal‚Äîit‚Äôs a cultural experience you‚Äôll remember and want to share with friends and family.

The  Doro Wot plate was so delicious, perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection. The unique spyce flavor is amazing. The prices are reasonable and Mr Tamrat (Owner) treated me like family. I highly recommend First Cup Ethiopian Restaurant to anyone looking for a great Ethiopian Food or coffee.
We visited this restaurant for the first time today. The food was great and the people were kind. We would highly recommend this place!

name: Calabash African Kitchen

reviews.text: Food is amazing! The best goat pepper I had! Snapper was scrumptious! First time ever having oxtail soup and don‚Äôt know how I have lived without it. We also had the chicken empanadas but wasn‚Äôt able to get a picture before we dug in. They were so good! Drinks are amazing! I highly recommend the Lemon Sip! My experience at calabash was 8/10

The only thing for me they sells empty jellof rice for $21 and sell meats separately $8 or so while on the menu they are vegetables and fish or meat but when it served it some how different. This was such a great experience! It was my daughter‚Äôs first time and she ordered the egusi, I ordered the red pepper stew with beef and fufu on the side. Food was incredible and the staff was so warm and welcoming! 10/10 experience, will definitely come back!

This was my first time having  African food and it did not disappoint. The food was very flavorful. The spices used made my taste buds dance. The staff was really friendly and the ambiance was great. I will definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone living or visiting Las Vegas this restaurant is a must. My only regret is that I went on my last day in  Las Vegas and I will have to wait until my next visit to Vegas to eat this amazing food again.

My god is this food good! Everything was fresh and seasoned to perfection. Great atmosphere and amazing service! Thank you Nyla for walking us through our first Senegambian food experience. Highly recommend!

name: Nigerian Cuisine by MJ

Horrible Nigerian food experience in Las Vegas!!! We paid over $80 for the meals we order and waited over an hour before food arrives. No meat on the food!!! Do not waste your money at this place.

This restaurant should not exist at all, I was on a vacation in Vegas, and the moment I came in town, I decided to check if there's an African Restaurant on doordash, and bang this restaurant pop up without me looking at the review, I placed an order for a 2 jollof rice, 1 for rounded and egunsi, and a plate of pepper soup  , spending over 116$, jollof rice doesn't even taste like a restaurant jollof rice, the moment I ordered on doordash, I realized they didn't ask me for the option of protein on my food, I called the restaurant and a guy picked up,  and after I explained the situation he got my order and told me I ordered 2 sides of jollof rice and it doesn't come with meat, at the end of the call, he said I will throw some goat meat in there buddy and dude hung up, I got my order and it was a mess, the pounded yam doesn't even taste like pounded yam, either flower or pounded, the egunsi was all white , no sign of vegetable what so ever in it, I manage to eat the pounded yam but trust me, I had food poisoning for the first 3 days of my vacation,  I tried leaving feedback on doordash but for whatever reason it didn't let me  ,saying I can't get refund. name: Nigerian Food
vicinity: 953 E Sahara Ave E-22, Las Vegas

reviews.text:
First time trying fufu and egusi soup. Got level 3 I believe and it was tasty although next time I'd go higher. Service was nice and the restaurant was cozy and I really liked the dish a lot.

It's also in a neat little area with a great view of the strip once you walk out.

Amazing Nigerian food, and if you haven't had it before she will help guide you.  Get off the Strip and come eat fantastic food!  Call ahead if you're in a hurry, all food is made fresh.  Homemade style.

Food was magically delicious!! If you want authentic Nigerian cuisine, then lol no further. Whenever I travel I always look for a Nigerian restaurant to try and besides me going to Nigeria last year, this is as fresh and authentic as it gets. With it being made fresh, it will take more time to
Prepare but it‚Äôs worth it and very professional

I had a truly disappointing experience with the owner‚Äôs service. Her rudeness and lack of basic customer service skills were shocking. After we were told to expect a 55-minute wait, we were informed via text over an hour later that our food was ready. The kicker? She expected us to arrive in just 2 minutes, despite it being already 7:55 PM!

When we explained that our Uber was on the way, she had the audacity to question why she should wait for us. Seriously? She claimed to be a pharmacy, but that doesn‚Äôt excuse her unprofessional behavior. To top it all off, her own business hours on Google clearly state that they close at 9:00 PM!

This experience was not just frustrating; it was infuriating. Customer service should be a priority, and this encounter proved otherwise. I won‚Äôt be returning.

Absolutely fantastic first experience trying nigerian food. Our server was extremely kind, she even warmed up our leftovers before we left because our hotel room does not have a microwave. The jollof rice and egusi soup were delicious. Definitely a place I will come back to next time I'm in Vegas.

name: Gursha Ethiopian Restaurant
vicinity: 3711 S Valley View Blvd suit H, Las Vegas

reviews.text:
I LOVE small businesses and small restaurants. This was my 1st visit to Gursha and I'll DEFINITELY be coming back again! Gursha is a very warm and inviting restaurant. I was welcomed and seated immediately. Having only had Ethiopian food once before, decades ago as a teenager in Chicago, I wasn't sure what to try from the menu. The recommendations were soooo greatly appreciated. The lamb special was AMAZING!!! Absolutely DELICIOUS!!!
Finished the meal with baklava and spiced tea for desert. Very nice too.
The Ethiopian music playing on the TV added to the relaxing mood.
Check this place out. It's a local gem here in Vegas...and only a few minutes drive off of The Strip if you're visiting.
Highly recommend.

First time trying this cuisine and wow! Splendid! Mimi was a sweetheart and cooked the meal entirely by herself from scratch all while teaching us about the food. It was great, Thank you Mimi!!

Highly recommend for people who have never tried Ethiopian before - step outside your comfort zone for a wonderful meal at a local business :)

We can't say enough good things about our experience here. Mimi the owner is the most warm, friendly person. We haven't had a lot of experience eating Ethiopian food and her recommendations were so perfect. The food was incredibly flavorful the most wonderful comfort food. She even showed us how to use our hands to scoop the injira bread into all the yummy stews and fed my toddler and mother in law a bite. We left feeling so content and full!

Simple and quiet inside.

Mimi extended very warm hospitality.

It was our first time having Ethiopian food and what a good place to experience it for the first time.

We shared a veg platter and golden beef tips. All the veg was absolutely delicious.

We finished with tiramisu which was also good, Mimi picked it out for us. Absolutely suggest checking it out.

I‚Äôve been eating Ethiopian food for over 20 years, so I‚Äôve developed certain expectations when it comes to freshness and quality; especially when it comes to traditional dishes made without preservatives.

I also have a very sensitive stomach, and after trying six different Ethiopian restaurants in the Vegas area, this is the only one that gave me absolutely no digestive issues. I ordered the veggie platter and was not disappointed!

The portions were generous enough to split into two smaller meals. The injera was light, fluffy, and gluten-free, and you can really taste that it‚Äôs freshly made. The greens and the cabbage/potato stew were standouts ‚Äî cooked perfectly, flavorful, and tender without being overdone.

I‚Äôd rank Lucy‚Äôs as a close second, but their greens were more like plain spinach without much spice or depth. Here, though, every dish has that long-stewed, soulful flavor that‚Äôs both comforting and easy to digest.

With so many vegan and gluten-free options, this place is a must-try ‚Äî especially for anyone who appreciates authentic Ethiopian cooking that‚Äôs as kind to the stomach as it is to the taste buds.

This is the best Ethiopian restaurant that we have ever experienced!  The food is absolutely delicious and the service is magnificent.  Hannah went above and beyond to make us feel welcome.  Her recommendation enabled us to try small portions of each special dish.  We will be new regular customers at Lucy from now on.  Highly recommend giving it a try.

My husband wanted to try something ‚Äúnew‚Äù üôÇ
I‚Äôve eaten the food before but not at this location. It was delicious!
We ordered 1 meat combo, 1 meat and veggie combo and 1 veggie combo. If we would have ordered two combo platters it would have been enough for the 4 of us.

For my second stop on my Vegas Ethiopian mini food tour, I visited Lucy‚Äôs Ethiopian Restaurant and ordered the veggie platter.
The injera was tasty and well made ‚Äî a little more acidic than I prefer, but still delicious. The legume stews were cooked nicely with good texture and mild flavor.

The cabbage and carrot mix was tender but a bit light on seasoning, and the Gomen was the one real disappointment ‚Äî they seemed more like steamed spinach rather than the slow-cooked, spice-rich greens I typically expect.

That said, the atmosphere here is wonderful ‚Äî lively, family-oriented, and full of energy. There‚Äôs a bar and a social, welcoming vibe that makes it easy to see why people love gathering here.

Overall, I‚Äôd say Lucy‚Äôs is a solid second to Gursha in terms of food quality, but it‚Äôs an excellent choice if you‚Äôre looking for a fun, casual night out with friends or family and still want a comforting Ethiopian meal
Best Ethiopian restaurant I‚Äôve ever been to and I‚Äôve been to more than 30! Staff is so nice and food is amazing! Don‚Äôt miss out on this opportunity on delicious Ethiopian food üíï

reviews.author_name: Green Sea Shells Mag: Wellness by KK
reviews.text:
If you‚Äôre in Las Vegas and craving Ethiopian cuisine, Lucy Ethiopian Restaurant is a decent choice. Tucked away in a quieter neighborhood just off the Strip, it‚Äôs easy to find with plenty of parking. We discovered it thanks to our Eritrean cab driver, who highly recommended it.

We ordered a veggie combo and two samosas, which were the perfect portions for our family of three. The food had a home-style touch, satisfying without feeling heavy‚Äîsomething we appreciated. The service was surprisingly quick, especially for an Ethiopian restaurant, and the staff was warm and welcoming.

That said, there‚Äôs room for improvement. The women‚Äôs restroom was clogged during our visit, and while the flavors were enjoyable, they could have been a bit more complex. As someone who regularly cooks Ethiopian food and has dined at nearly every Ethiopian restaurant in NYC and Los Angeles, I‚Äôd say Lucy is a good option if you‚Äôre craving hearty vegetarian dishes or Ethiopian fare in Las Vegas.

name: NU Ethiopian kitchen
vicinity: 4230 S Decatur Blvd Suite 200, Las Vegas

reviews.text: Great Ethiopian food and service. Very vegan friendly. Got two veggie combos for two people, though a single veggie combo could definitely be enough for two to share with how generous the portions are. The stewed red lentils (center of the plate) and the beets were my favorite, though even the potato and cabbage and collard greens were so flavorful (honestly everything was). Will definitely be coming back!
So happy there's another Ethiopian dining option in the valley.  Good food and great service.   Standouts are the lentil samosas and coffee.

Amazing food and great service!
Mini took good care of us and made us feel like we were guests of royalty at her home! Really health, great prices and you won't leave hungry.
Good food. The injera is really good.  The spice and flavoring are on point.  The service is a little slow and takes some prompting.
Excellent veggie combo and coffee. Very friendly service   Can't wait to go back!
